intro: Streptocarpus campanulatus, commonly known as the bell streptocarpus, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to violet. The plant typically grows as a perennial herb with fleshy, lance-shaped leaves. It prefers bright, indirect light and well-draining soil, making it a popular choice for indoor cultivation. Its unique floral structure and vibrant colors make it a desirable ornamental plant.
